name: Isolation
description: `Form.Isolation` lets you isolate parts of your form so data and validations are not shared between the `Form.Handler` until you want to.

props.name: path
props.doc: JSON Pointer to define the object key for all the generated nested field data. When provided, Form.Isolation will inherit schema validation from the parent Form.Handler for fields within this path.

props.name: transformOnCommit
props.doc: Transform the data before it gets committed to the form. The first parameter is the isolated data object. The second parameter is the outer context data object (Form.Handler).

props.name: commitHandleRef
props.doc: Provide a ref to a function that can be called from any location to commit the data to the form.

props.name: bubbleValidation
props.doc: Prevent the form from being submitted when there are fields with errors inside the Form.Isolation.

props.name: preventUncommittedChanges
props.doc: Prevents uncommitted changes before the form is submitted. Will display an error message if user tries to submit without committing their changes.

props.name: resetDataAfterCommit
props.doc: If set to `true`, the Form.Isolation will reset its data context after committing the data to the outer context.

props.name: dataReference
props.doc: Provide a reference by using `Form.Isolation.createDataReference`.

props.name: defaultData
props.doc: Default source data, only used if no other source is available, and not leading to updates if changed after mount.

props.name: data
props.doc: Dynamic source data used as both initial data, and updates internal data if changed after mount.

props.name: id
props.doc: Unique id for connecting Form.Handler and helper tools such as Form.useData.

props.name: schema
props.doc: JSON Schema for validation of the data set. IMPORTANT: When using JSON Schema validation, you MUST provide an `ajvInstance` prop.

props.name: errorMessages
props.doc: Object containing error messages by either type of JSON Pointer path and type. The messages can be a React.ReactNode or a string.

props.name: ajvInstance
props.doc: REQUIRED when using JSON Schema validation. Provide your own custom Ajv instance: import Ajv from "@dnb/eufemia/extensions/forms" and pass ajvInstance={makeAjvInstance()}. This ensures your bundle only includes AJV when you actually need it. More info in the [Schema validation](/uilib/extensions/forms/Form/schema-validation/#custom-ajv-instance-and-keywords) section.

props.name: transformIn
props.doc: Mutate the data context (internally as well) based on your criteria: `({ path, value, data, props, internal }) => 'new value'`. It will iterate on each data entry (/path).

props.name: transformOut
props.doc: Mutate the data before it enters onSubmit or onChange based on your criteria: `({ path, value, data, props, internal }) => 'new value'`. It will iterate on each data entry (/path).

props.name: required
props.doc: Make all fields required.

props.name: disabled
props.doc: Disable all fields.

props.name: locale
props.doc: Locale (language) to use for all nested Eufemia components.

props.name: countryCode
props.doc: Will change the country code for fields supporting `countryCode`. You can also set a path as the value, e.g. `/myCountryCodePath`.

props.name: children
props.doc: Contents.

events.name: onCommit
events.doc: Will be called on a nested form context commit â€“ if validation has passed. The first parameter is the committed data object. The second parameter is an object containing a method to clear the internal data `{ clearData }`.

events.name: onChange
events.doc: Will be called when a value of a field was changed by the user, with the data set (including the changed value) as argument. When an async function is provided, it will show an indicator on the current label during a field change. Related props: `minimumAsyncBehaviorTime` and `asyncSubmitTimeout`. You can return an error or an object with these keys `{ info: 'Info message', warning: 'Warning message', error: Error('My error') } as const` in addition to { success: 'saved' } indicate the field was saved. Will emit unvalidated by default and validated when an async function is provided (like `onSubmit`). The second parameter is an object containing the `filterData`, `resetForm` and `clearData` functions.

events.name: onPathChange
events.doc: Will be called when a value of a field was changed by the user, with the `path` (JSON Pointer) and new `value` as arguments. Can be an async function. Will emit unvalidated by default and validated when `onChange` is an async function.

events.name: onClear
events.doc: Will be called when the form is cleared via `Form.clearData` or via the `onSubmit` event (or `onCommit`) argument `{ clearData }`.
